This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. content.raw:
I noticed a tiny bug:

1. On the main window, insert a shape

2. Enter the model edit, insert a shape

3. Start making a joint, select the 2nd shape as parent

4. If you click and drag on the other shape, the camera orbits (as long as you move the mouse on top of the shape) and on release the orbit indicator (yellow sphere) remains on the shape. And at some point the shape actually became selected, I'm not able to reproduce though.

5. If you click and drag on the ground plane, nothing happens, i.e. you can't orbit.
content.html:
I noticed a tiny bug:

  1. On the main window, insert a shape

  2. Enter the model edit, insert a shape

  3. Start making a joint, select the 2nd shape as parent

  4. If you click and drag on the other shape, the camera orbits (as long as you move the mouse on top of the shape) and on release the orbit indicator (yellow sphere) remains on the shape. And at some point the shape actually became selected, I'm not able to reproduce though.

  5. If you click and drag on the ground plane, nothing happens, i.e. you can't orbit.

This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. update.description:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. update.description:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. update.title: Joint maker back to life

content.raw:
I made a few updates:

* 'Add' button resized.
* Default joint limits set to -pi and pi.
* Fixed problem with universal joints.
* Clarified the state of 'auto-disable' and 'static'. I've modified the label next to the checkbox. Now it says 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.
* Fixed problem with mouse/key handlers that was preventing the model insertion in the main window. 

False alarms:

* 'anchor' fields seems to work.
* Deleting one link attached to another with a joint. The first click selects the whole model, you need a second click for selecting a specific link.
content.html:
I made a few updates:

  • 'Add' button resized.
  • Default joint limits set to -pi and pi.
  • Fixed problem with universal joints.
  • Clarified the state of 'auto-disable' and 'static'. I've modified the label next to the checkbox. Now it says 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.
  • Fixed problem with mouse/key handlers that was preventing the model insertion in the main window.

False alarms:

  • 'anchor' fields seems to work.
  • Deleting one link attached to another with a joint. The first click selects the whole model, you need a second click for selecting a specific link.

update.description:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening.
